title: Ticket #377: limit rate of job removal
description:
Extracted from condor-admin #18834:

As you know, Fermilab runs several configurations which are using the GlideWMS and are calling glexec twice at the start and stop of every job. This has opened new denial of service modes against our authentication server. We have more than once been swamped because someone either started 80K very short jobs, or condor_rm'ed several clusters of 1K jobs each.

Is it possible to throttle the rate at which condor_rm removes jobs? (We are attempting to do this at the moment by use of a wrapper script to condor_rm, but it would be very nice to have a configuration knob for this function).
